title: Infographic-Based Education for Enhancing Advanced Visual Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic visual data interpretation skills and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Designed for language domain majors (linguistics/communication), learners participate in online and offline activities using personal devices, with intensive 3-hour sessions held twice weekly over four weeks.

learning_goals: Learners can interpret complex language data visualizations in infographics with 85% accuracy
Learners can design and produce language-learning infographics using specified tools (e.g., Canva)
Learners can evaluate the visualization of infographics (components, color/font usage, information structuring) produced through peer assessment using a 5-level rubric

resources: Free Design Tools (e.g., Canva, Adobe Spark)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
